TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NumberSubstitutionMethod extends System.Enum

summary.span: 定義列舉值類別，這個類別指定要對文字執行中之數字執行的數字取代型別。

span.span: Defines an enumerator class that specifies the type of number substitution to perform on numbers in a text run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 大部分的文化特性會使用十進位系統來表示數字，但許多的文化特性使用不同的數字形狀。Most cultures use the decimal system to represent numbers, but many cultures use different digit shapes. 下表顯示數個不同的文化特性所使用的編號系統。The following table shows several numbering systems used by different cultures. ![數字替換圖像一覽表](~/add/media/numbersubstitution01.png "數字替換圖像一覽表")![Table of number substitution glyphs](~/add/media/numbersubstitution01.png "Table of number substitution glyphs") 在不同文化特性的數字的外觀的範例Example of the appearance of digits in different cultures 因為與不同的是字母、 數字用於計算不足夠的數字形狀，每一組提供替代的 Unicode 字碼指標。It is not sufficient to provide alternate Unicode code points for each set of digit shapes, because, unlike letters, digits are used in calculations. 每個應用程式、 每個作業系統，以及每個執行階段程式庫包含程式碼，專門用來將內部的二進位格式的數值轉換成字元字串，反之亦然。Every application, every operating system, and every run-time library contains code dedicated to converting an internal binary format numeric value to a string of characters, and vice versa. 這些轉換常式會被編碼為使用 Unicode 數字 」 0030"到"0039 」。These conversion routines are coded to use Unicode digits "0030" through "0039". 類別提供的功能，可讓不同的文化特性，以在轉譯階段取代適當的數字形狀。The class provides functionality that allows different cultures to substitute the appropriate digit shapes at rendering time. 這項功能很類似提供字型替換和語言相關字型呈現時所用的。This functionality is similar to the one used for providing font substitution and language dependent font rendering. > [!NOTE] > 許多文化特性會捨棄其傳統數字的圖形，並採用西式數字的圖形，因此數字取代功能會辨識各文化特性的傳統數字形狀與國際標準數字之間的差異。Many cultures are discarding their traditional digits shapes and adopting Western digits shapes, therefore the number substitution functionality recognizes the distinction for each culture between traditional digit shapes and national standard digit shapes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod AsCulture = int32(0)

summary.span: 指定應該要以數字文化特性的 屬性值來決定取代方法。

span.span: Specifies that the substitution method should be determined based on the number culture's property value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod Context = int32(1)

summary.span: 如果數字文化特性為阿拉伯或波斯文化特性，指定數字依賴於內容。

span.span: If the number culture is an Arabic or Farsi culture, specifies that the digits depend on the context.

summary.span: 要使用傳統數字或拉丁數字會取決於前方最接近的強式字元，如果沒有強式字元則取決於段落的文字方向。

span.span: Either traditional or Latin digits are used depending on the nearest preceding strong character, or, if there is none, the text direction of the paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod European = int32(2)

summary.span: 指定歐洲數字中永遠會呈現字碼指標 0x30-0x39，在這種情況下將不會執行任何的取代。

span.span: Specifies that code points 0x30-0x39 are always rendered as European digits, in which case, no number substitution is performed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod NativeNational = int32(3)

summary.span: 指定會使用國際數字的數字文化特性來呈現數字，如同文化特性的 屬性值所指定。

span.span: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the national digits for the number culture, as specified by the culture's property value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.NumberSubstitutionMethod Traditional = int32(4)

summary.span: 指定會使用傳統數字的數字文化特性來呈現數字。

span.span: Specifies that numbers are rendered using the traditional digits for the number culture.

summary.span: 對大多數的文化特性來說，這會與 列舉值相同。

span.span: For most cultures, this is the same as the enumeration value.

summary.span: 不過，使用 卻會在某些阿拉伯文化特性中呈現拉丁數字，而使用 則會在所有的阿拉伯文化特性中呈現阿拉伯數字。

span.span: However, using can result in Latin digits for some Arabic cultures, whereas using results in Arabic digits for all Arabic cultures.
